summary: This is an email from an individual (likely a prosecutor or investigator) forwarding a voicemail received from Congresswoman Frankel regarding the Epstein case. The email indicates that attorney Jack Scarola, who represents a client (likely a victim), facilitated the contact.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.role: Attorney representing a client in the Epstein case
persons.context: He informed the email's author that someone from Congress had reached out about the Epstein case and provided the author's cellphone number to Congresswoman Frankel.

persons.name: Congresswoman Frankel
persons.context: She left a voicemail for the email's author seeking to discuss the Epstein case, as facilitated by attorney Jack Scarola.

connections.description: Scarola provided Frankel with the contact information for the email's author regarding the Epstein case.
Scarola represents a client (likely a victim) in the Epstein case and communicated with Frankel, a member of Congress, about the matter.

events.title: Congressional Inquiry Voicemail
events.description: Congresswoman Frankel left a voicemail for an individual (likely a prosecutor/investigator) seeking to discuss the Epstein case, facilitated by attorney Jack Scarola.

keyFacts: A member of Congress, Rep. Frankel, was actively seeking information about the Epstein case as of July 2021.
Attorney Jack Scarola, representing a client in the case, acted as an intermediary to connect Congressional inquiry with a case investigator/prosecutor.
The communication shows ongoing political interest and investigation into the Epstein case years after his death.
